intro: Linkia dillwyniodes, commonly known as the Dillwyn's linkia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the spring and early summer. Linkia dillwyniodes is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
